experience: You and Thomas both know Craig McLaughlin, Luma Dahlbacka, and 57 others
You both worked at Charles Schwab
Thomas worked at Charles Schwab before you started

•	Responsible for optimizing channel investment portfolios and ensuring efficient execution by establishing traceability of planned initiatives, programs and projects to the overall channel goals and objectives.•	Provide inputs into the investment work plan through identification of high priority business capabilities, scoping of high-level bodies of work to deliver on a strategy, and articulation of relationships between planned investments•	Provide a cohesive view of channel-wide high-level requirements•	Create and maintain business blueprints (e.g. Capabilities, Value Chain, Business Strategy, Initiatives, Organization, Product, Policy, Stakeholder, Information (Data), and IT Touch-points Maps).•	Create, maintain, and mentor the mapping and use of business process models.

Corporate Practice Lead, Software Requirements Lifecycle•	Established Schwab’s Business Analyst Practice Community (BAPC) with a population of over 200 BAs and Product Owners.•	Designed and delivered high-level requirements discovery workshops (Agile, RUP, Waterfall), leading to clear project execution roadmap. Audience: project sponsors, stakeholders, project teams, legal and compliance, etc.•	Designed and delivered training in end-to-end requirements elicitation and documentation utilizing visual modeling techniques and requirements management principals such as traceability and attribute management. Audience: business analysts, project managers, product owners.•	Business Architecture evangelist: Successfully implemented and promoted the linking of business processes created by BAs, with business capabilities, value chain mapping, org overlays, etc., for a new company-wide Business Architecture repository.•	Vendor relationship Business Owner for requirements-specific desktop tools (Blueprint, Rational Suite, iGrafx).  Conducted contract negotiations; defined implementation strategy, SLAs, roll-out plans, training.•	Mentor for Agile and RUP methodology to teams and individuals in a cross-enterprise environment.

Central Portfolio Management Office (CPMO), Schwab Information Technology Enterprise•	Development methodology mentoring at the cross-enterprise level, program and project management coaching for CPMO-managed projects; annual budget over $200 million.•	Direct Reports: managed 28 project managers and business analysts, full-time and contract.•	Provided on-demand expert PM and analyst services on technically complex, highly visible projects.•	Oversight of project launch and project close enabling project consistency and repeatable processes. •	Instituted post-release evaluation standards and lessons learned “capture and use” processes.

Investor Services Portfolio Management Office, Schwab Information Technology Enterprise•	Defined processes and standards for project lifecycle; implemented best practices resulting in improved quality of metrics and reporting.•	Coordinated Executive and Local Governance roles and responsibilities; authored Whitepaper.•	Collaborated with Development Practices team to iteratively enhance quality of project templates and methods.
PROGRAM MENTOR – RATIONAL UNIFIED PROCESS AND TOOLS (Consultant)

•	RUP mentor for Investor Services Enterprise; provided program and project management coaching for PMO. •	Mentored management to Executive Vice President level on technical project processes and system integration.•	Provided advice to construction of an Integrated Test Environment: enabled QA team to perform end-to-end systems testing in an environment emulating Schwab customer experience.•	Coordinated release management oversight activities for over 30 systems with a complex array of interdependencies streamlining processes and reducing collisions.•	Authored Project Delivery Process template for the PMO; developed roadmaps, workflow diagrams.

Sr. Systems Architect, WFS at Wells Fargo
January 27, 2009, Thomas worked with M. Erik in the same group

It was a pleasure to work with Thomas on an extremely difficult and challenging project in Egypt.  Thomas' flair for business and customer needs and requirements helped complete what might otherwise have been a disastrous situation.  We both worked long hours, but Thomas always had a smile and always seemed to keep the various situations light when, in reality, they were heavy!  I would be very happy to work with Thomas again.

Sandeep Reddy Anand, MBA
Business Lead - BPM Center of Excellence at Charles Schwab
July 26, 2015, Thomas was senior to Sandeep Reddy but didn’t manage directly

In my role as a PMO Managing Director, and as a Software Requirements Lifecycle Practice Lead, I've had the pleasure of working with Sandeep in his position as a Business Analyst at Charles Schwab for a number of years.  Sandeep is a thoroughly responsible and hard working individual. He has the very valuable capability to listen to both business and technical stakeholders, and deduce the core elements that they are communicating.  I have found that he excels at documenting the essence of what business stakeholders need, and not necessarily what they believe they want. This skill can save both business subject matter experts and development teams a great deal of frustration, as well as many man-hours, in building software that provides a high-value functionality. He provides sound recommendations, and has the ability to facilitate requirements elicitation workshops, as well as present business and technical solutions to C-level members of management. His focus is on providing clarity of purpose; he is timely in his deliverables, and works efficiently. His diplomatic skills, absolutely necessary in software development efforts, are excellent, and he knows how to deliver bad news in a way that allows a team to positively move forward.Sandeep’s work at Schwab has been highly beneficial to us, and I am happy to recommend him for any team looking to build complex, functional software in a timely manner.
Sandeep Reddy Anand, MBA

summary: •  Skilled at creating project alignment among stakeholders, sponsors, subject-matter experts, development, testing, end users, legal, and compliance. Excellent communication and mediation skills: bringing parties together to identify and clarify common goals, drive consensus, induce project traction.•  Accomplished at employing software development best practices to define core project path: milestones, tasks, risk identification and mitigation, team member engagement.•  More than 20 years’ experience providing requirements delivery and Requirements Management Lifecycle: elicitation, analysis, documentation, ambiguity mitigation, traceability, attribute management, and user acceptance.•  Expertise in providing business process analysis, having provided mapping (BPMN), simulation, and re-engineering in a broad array of industries including: Internet commerce, financial services, legal, and telecommunications. Outstanding analytical ability to document current-state, and future-state processes, identify inefficiencies and opportunities for improvement, and define solutions satisfying all stakeholders.•  Experienced and highly regarded mentor providing methodology (Agile, Rational Unified Process-RUP), and best practices training to executives, product owners, business analysts, and project managers. Effective staff management, program & project management, cost estimation & tracking.•  Accomplished facilitator: JAD sessions, visioning and high-level requirements discovery sessions, requirements management, and business process identification workshops.
name: Thomas Steiner, PMP
title: Business Architect at Wells Fargo
